metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7537 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Django 2.0 before 2.0.3, 1.11 before 1.11.11,and 1.8 before 1.8.19. If django.utils.text.Truncator's chars() and words()methods were passed the html=True argument, they were extremely slow toevaluate certain inputs due to a catastrophic backtracking vulnerability ina regular expression. The chars() and words() methods are used to implementthe truncatechars_html and truncatewords_html template filters, which werethus vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7537` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-django - 1.8.7-1ubuntu5.6
python-django-common - 1.8.7-1ubuntu5.6
python3-django - 1.8.7-1ubuntu5.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-django package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.7-1ubuntu5.6').
